bibParser

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • bibParser.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Class contain static methods to cope with parsing bibTex files. Class is linked with class Paper

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Parser() 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String cutPartInsideCharacters(java.util.Scanner input, java.lang.String firstLine, char openingChar, char closingChar)
      Take input and first line of text to parse and return well balanced entry from opening char to proper closing char entries can be nested
      static java.lang.String cutPartInsideCurlyBrackets(java.util.Scanner input, java.lang.String firstLine)
      Take input and first line of text to parse and return well bracket-balanced entry from { to proper } It use cutPartInsideCharacters
      static java.lang.String cutPartInsideRoundBrackets(java.util.Scanner input, java.lang.String firstLine)
      Take input and first line of text to parse and return well bracket-balanced entry from ( to proper ) It use cutPartInsideCharacters
      static void parse(java.io.File file)
      Method, which process bibTex file and create Paper objects Process String entries Sent type and content of entry and map of Strings to Paper constructor
      static int parseField(java.lang.String in, int i, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> strings, java.lang.StringBuilder fieldType, java.lang.StringBuilder fieldContent)
      Take whole entry(in), start processing from i'th sign Return fieldType and fieldContent of first field after i'th sign (in StringBuilder's) and position i after fieldContent

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static void parse(java.io.File file)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Method, which process bibTex file and create Paper objects Process String entries Sent type and content of entry and map of Strings to Paper constructor
        Parameters:
        file - file in bibTex format, which is parsed by program
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception from invoking Paper constructor, handled to add stacktrace

      • cutPartInsideCurlyBrackets

        public static java.lang.String cutPartInsideCurlyBrackets(java.util.Scanner input,
                                                          java.lang.String firstLine)
        Take input and first line of text to parse and return well bracket-balanced entry from { to proper } It use cutPartInsideCharacters
        Parameters:
        input - Scanner which read parsed file
        firstLine - First line of text to parse
        Returns:
        Entry in form String, from { sign to }

        Take input and first line of text to parse and return well bracket-balanced entry from ( to proper ) It use cutPartInsideCharacters

      • cutPartInsideCharacters

        public static java.lang.String cutPartInsideCharacters(java.util.Scanner input,
                                                       java.lang.String firstLine,
                                                       char openingChar,
                                                       char closingChar)
        Take input and first line of text to parse and return well balanced entry from opening char to proper closing char entries can be nested
        Parameters:
        input - Scanner which read parsed file
        firstLine - First line of text to parse, has to contain openingChar
        openingChar - Sign which open entry
        closingChar - Sign which end entry
        Returns:

      • parseField

        public static int parseField(java.lang.String in,
                             int i,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> strings,
                             java.lang.StringBuilder fieldType,
                             java.lang.StringBuilder fieldContent)
        Take whole entry(in), start processing from i'th sign Return fieldType and fieldContent of first field after i'th sign (in StringBuilder's) and position i after fieldContent
        Parameters:
        in - whole entry
        i - position in processing 'in'
        strings - map of String to parse
        fieldType - StringBuilder, add to it name of processed field
        fieldContent - StringBuilder, add to it content of processed field
        Returns:
        position i after processing
